carousel_items: Take this medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Drink plenty of liquids when taking the medication.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause rash.

basics.benefits_moa: Bactrim is a combination antibiotic that contains sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim. It kills bacteria by preventing them from making proteins and other chemicals that keep them alive.
basics.bottom_line: Bactrim is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as a generic. However, you can be more likely to sunburn. Also, it can cause birth defects, so talk to your doctor if you're pregnant.
downsides: Makes your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Has to be taken with plenty of liquids.

downsides_processed.orig: Makes your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Has to be taken with plenty of liquids.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see if Bactrim responds to your infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see if Bactrim responds to your infection.

userStories.tip: Take probiotics along with this as it upsets the stomach. Also, I find taking it first thing in the morning and just right before bed the best.
I broke the pill in half to take it. It made it easier  to swallow. Definitely stay out of the sun.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Bactrim put me in a state of constant anxiety after the very first dose. After two days, I refused to take anymore of it.

drugs.name: Bactrim

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take this medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Drink plenty of liquids when taking the medication.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause rash.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Bactrim can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Bactrim can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Bactrim. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

description_processed.orig: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Bactrim. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: If you are pregnant, talk to your doctor about alternatives as Bactrim may damage the fetus.

description_processed.orig: If you are pregnant, talk to your doctor about alternatives as Bactrim may damage the fetus.

points.name: chills

points.name: elevation of serum transaminase and bilirubin

carousel_items: Try to drink plenty of clear liquids. Having diarrhea can make you dehydrated.
The correct dose of Imodium may be different depending on age. Use the dosing chart to find the right amount of medicine based on age and weight.
Shake Imodium liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
Check with your baby doctor before using if you're breastfeeding.
Ask your doctor before taking Imodium if you have a fever, liver problems, mucus in your stool or are taking antibiotics.
Don't use if you have blood in your stool or it's dark or black in color.
Stop using Imodium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly or your symptoms get worse after 2 days. This could be serious.

basics.benefits_moa: Imodium is an antidiarrheal medicine. It's actually an opioid related to morphine, though it doesn't affect the brain like opioid pain medicines do. Instead, it works directly on muscles in your large intestine to stop contractions and increase the time it takes for stool to move through. The result is less diarrhea and more formed stool.
basics.bottom_line: One day is too many days to have diarrhea. Having Imodium on hand to relieve your symptoms can be a life-saver.
downsides: Imodium only treats your diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea may be caused by a number of conditions and will need specific treatment that deals with the underlying issue.

Studies in people taking Imodium for chronic diarrhea showed if the maximum number of doses didn't relieve symptoms in 10 days, then it probably won't work for that condition. You can talk to your doctor about other treatment options.

downsides_processed.orig: Imodium only treats your diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea may be caused by a number of conditions and will need specific treatment that deals with the underlying issue.

Studies in people taking Imodium for chronic diarrhea showed if the maximum number of doses didn't relieve symptoms in 10 days, then it probably won't work for that condition. You can talk to your doctor about other treatment options.

upsides: Most people who take Imodium feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.
Imodium is used for short-term, chronic and traveler's diarrhea. It's also used for people who have diarrhea caused by cancer or certain medicines that treat cancer.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people who take Imodium feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.
Imodium is used for short-term, chronic and traveler's diarrhea. It's also used for people who have diarrhea caused by cancer or certain medicines that treat cancer.

userStories.tip: Generic loperamide is cheaper and works just as well as Imodium.

drugs.name: Imodium

labeled_indications.indication: Chronic diarrhea from Irritable Bowel Syndrome

off-label_indications.indication: Surgical removal of the rectum and colon

carousel_items_processed.orig: Try to drink plenty of clear liquids. Having diarrhea can make you dehydrated.
The correct dose of Imodium may be different depending on age. Use the dosing chart to find the right amount of medicine based on age and weight.
Shake Imodium liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
Check with your baby doctor before using if you're breastfeeding.
Ask your doctor before taking Imodium if you have a fever, liver problems, mucus in your stool or are taking antibiotics.
Don't use if you have blood in your stool or it's dark or black in color.
Stop using Imodium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly or your symptoms get worse after 2 days. This could be serious.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Very rarely, Imodium has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Very rarely, Imodium has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Imodium is broken down by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor. You may need a different dose, (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label) or another medicine to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Imodium is broken down by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor. You may need a different dose, (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label) or another medicine to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Serious intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Do not use if you have diarrhea with a high fever, blood in your stool, pain, swelling or bulging in your belly. People taking HIV medicine together with Imodium can have a serious intestinal problem called toxic megacolon.  Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you develop these symptoms or your diarrhea gets worse after 2 days.

description_processed.orig: Do not use if you have diarrhea with a high fever, blood in your stool, pain, swelling or bulging in your belly. People taking HIV medicine together with Imodium can have a serious intestinal problem called toxic megacolon.  Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you develop these symptoms or your diarrhea gets worse after 2 days.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Imodium is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Using Imodium is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

carousel_items: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any antacids with magnesium or aluminum by at least 2 hours.
Can take with or without food.

basics.benefits_moa: Azithromycin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Azithromycin is good for treating many bacterial infections. It is also available as generic. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease, myasthenia gravis, or on medications to thin the blood, as the doctor may write an alternative.
downsides: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

downsides_processed.orig: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.
Can be taken with or without food.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.
Can be taken with or without food.

carousel_items: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Take this medication with plenty of fluids.
Space out any medications containing aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches and insomnia.

basics.benefits_moa: Levofloxacin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Levofloxacin is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as generic. However, it can cause damage to your tendons, and make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
downsides: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.
You have to space out any medications with aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches, and insomnia.

downsides_processed.orig: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.

You have to space out any medications with aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.

userStories.tip: It ruined multiple tendons in both my hands. I had to have the tendons surgically repaired. After that I developed tendon damage in both legs and my rotator cuff-but it totally cleared up my sinus infection!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I stopped taking this medicine after I started having pain in my achilles tendon. I was afraid my tendon would rupture and that I would never be comfortable running again. The pain lasted for a few weeks! Don't take it unless you have to!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Had to stop after 3 days. Serious side effects. Too strong for me!

Do not take this medication! It will mess up your joints/tendons and cause multiple other problems. There are several FB groups with 1000's of victims from being "Floxed".  Cipro causes same damage also! Do your Research before taking!!!

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you notice pain in your Achilles tendons, contact your doctor.
Wear sunscreen if you're going to be out in the sun.
Take the medication exactly how the doctor tells you to.
Take this medication with plenty of fluids.
Space out any medications containing aluminum, magnesium or zinc by at least 2 hours.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Can cause changes in taste, headaches and insomnia.

risks_warnings.title: Tendon rupture
risks_warnings.description: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: If you notice redness/inflammation, pain or swelling in your joints or muscles, especially in the Achilles tendon, contact your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

description_processed.orig: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

description_processed.orig: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Levofloxacin. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

description_processed.orig: Your skin can be more likely to sunburn while you're on Levofloxacin. Avoid tanning or tanning beds, and put on sunblock if you have to be out in the sun.

If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.
